FuncDef: The igmp static-group command configures an interface to statically join multicast groups. The undo igmp static-group command deletes the multicast groups that an interface statically joins. By default, an interface does not join any multicast group statically.
CLIs: igmp static-group <StaticGrp> [ inc-step-mask { <IncStepGrpMask> | <IncStepGrpMaskLen> } number <TotalNum> ] [ source <SourceAddr> ] dot1qvid <lowVidValue>
undo igmp static-group <StaticGrp> [ inc-step-mask { <IncStepGrpMask> | <IncStepGrpMaskLen> } number <TotalNum> ] [ source <SourceAddr> ] dot1qvid <lowVidValue>
ParentView: 100ge sub-interface view,10GE sub-interface view,200GE sub-interface view,25GE sub-interface view,400GE sub-interface view,50GE sub-interface view,Eth-Trunk sub-interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a static group address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Indicates the step mask of a group address in batch configuration mode.
-

Specifies the step mask of a group address in batch configuration mode, that is, the distance between two group addresses.
The value is in the wildcard mask format, and ranges from 0.0.0.1 to 15.255.254.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the length of the step mask in batch configuration mode.
The value is an integer that ranges from 5 to 32.

Specifies the number of group addresses in batch configuration mode.
The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 512.

Specifies a multicast source address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Statically adds a sub-interface for dot1q VLAN tag termination to a multicast group.
-

Specifies the lower limit of the VLAN ID.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094. For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1023.

Indicates all multicast groups that an interface statically joins.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-Eth-Trunk1.1] igmp static-group 225.0.0.1 inc-step-mask 0.0.0.1 number 17 dot1q vid 1
ExtraInfo: If a user needs to receive data of a multicast group for a long time, that is, there are stable multicast group members on the user network segment, you can configure an interface to statically join the multicast group. In this manner, the interface can quickly respond to user requests and shorten the channel switching time.
